text: Pratihara, or Pratihar is a clan of Gurjar ethnic group of Pakistan and India.They are primarily found in the Indian states of Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, and Uttarakhand, with a few in Pakistani Punjab. They ruled and established the Gurjara-Pratihara dynasty of medieval India from 550 CE up until 1050 CE. * * * * ==Variants== This Gurjar clan appears under several names, including Pratihara, Pratihar, Padhyar, Parihara, and Parihar. == Branches == *Bargujar *Bhumla == References == ==Notes== #James Macnabb Campbell (1901) Gazetteer of the Bombay Presidency: Volume 9, Part 1 Government Central Press. p. 482 Bombay (Presidency) "Special classes of Gujars only two have been traced Bad or Bir Gujars and Bhatti Gujars. Bad- Gurjjaras are an important class apparentlyrepre- senting a separate tribe of the original horde. The name Bad is supposed to mean barra or great." Category:Gurjar clans Category:Gurjar clans of Pakistan Category:Gurjar clans of India Category:Social groups of Gujarat Category:Ethnic groups in India Category:Gurjara-Pratihara Dynasty
title: Pratihar Gurjars
